message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about improving the attention accuracy of neural machine translation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves training a model to minimize a cost function, which suggests the involvement of machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper utilizes alignments of training sentence pairs, which could involve techniques such as reinforcement learning or supervised learning, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. The paper also involves improving translation quality, which could involve techniques such as neural networks or optimization algorithms, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves image captioning, which could involve techniques such as computer vision or deep learning, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a less likely but still possible sub-category.
